clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of the Switch From Sirolimus to Everolimus in Stable Maintenance Renal Transplant Patients Receiving a Calcineurin Inhibitor Free Regimen
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Arm, Prospective, Open-label, Pilot Study to Assess Effects of the Switch From Sirolimus to Everolimus in Stable Maintenance Renal Transplant Patients Receiving a Calcineurin Inhibitor Free Regimen

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess if a combination of everolimus, steroids, and mycophenolate mofetil is associated with a better renal function than sirolimus.

primary_outcome.measure: Renal function at M6 (glomerular filtration and tubular function).

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of biopsy-proven acute rejections and CMV infections

Laboratory parameters: hemoglobin, WBC, T-cell sub-populations, platelets, transaminases, total cholesterol, HDL and LDL cholesterol, apolipoproteins A1 and B, triglycerides, fasting glucose, HbA1c, LH, FSH, testosterone and TSH
Adverse events and serious adverse events, premature study treatment discontinuations.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- First or second renal transplantation (1 to 10 years post-transplant)
- Treatment with sirolimus + mycophenolate mofetil + steroids + ACE inhibitor or angiotensin II receptor antagonist + statin
Exclusion Criteria
- Treatment with a CNI or azathioprine
- Vascular rejection or biopsy-proven acute rejection within 3 months prior to screening
- Severe dyslipidemia Other protocol-defined inclusion / exclusion criteria may apply
